params.name: collectionId
params.doc: Id of the Collection to delete

params.name: collectionId
params.doc: Id of the Collection to retrieve

params.name: paging.cursor
params.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

params.name: collection
params.doc: Collection to be updated, may be partial

params.name: mask
params.doc: Explicit list of fields to update

docs.summary:
*
Update a Collection, supports partial update
Pass the latest `revision` for a successful update

*
Topic to send SSR invalidation messages to.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: Collection ID associated with this event.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether this event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (e.g., GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: Collection ID associated with this event.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether this event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (e.g., GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: Collection ID associated with this event.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether this event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (e.g., GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: imageInfo
members.doc: Image info - Wix Media Image. Required.

members.name: exif
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs describing the media in [Exchangeable Image File format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exif).

members.name: amount
members.doc:
Unsharp masking amount. Controls the sharpening strength.
Min: `0`
Max: `5`

members.name: radius
members.doc: Unsharp masking radius in pixels. Controls the sharpening width.

members.name: threshold
members.doc:
Unsharp masking threshold. Controls how different neighboring pixels must be for shapening to apply.
Min: `0`
Max: `1`

members.name: relativePath
members.doc: The path to that page - e.g /product-page/a-product

members.name: url
members.doc: The URL of that page. e.g https://mysite.com/product-page/a-product

members.name: props
members.doc: SEO tag attributes/properties (name, content, rel, href).

members.name: children
members.doc: Tag inner content e.g. `<title> inner content </title>`.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the tag is a custom tag.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc: disable auto creation of 301 redirects on slug changes (enabled by default).

docs.summary:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
 The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
 This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

*
Collection is the main entity of CollectionsService

members.name: revision
members.doc: Represents the current state of an item. Each time the item is modified, its `revision` changes. for an update operation to succeed, you MUST pass the latest revision

members.name: hidden
members.doc: Indicates if the collection is hidden from Portfolio

members.name: sortOrder
members.doc: if not present in an update it means the collection will be added as currentTimestamp - as the last collection

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Represents the time this Collection was created

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Represents the time this Collection was last updated

members.name: url
members.doc: Url and relative url of Collection - in order to receive this field in GET requests you will need to pass the `include_page_url` field

members.name: paths
members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:  
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: the msid the page is on

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: the msid the URI is on

members.name: uriPath
members.doc: URI path to invalidate (e.g. page/my/path) - without leading/trailing slashes

members.name: reason
members.doc:
tell us why you're invalidating the cache. You don't need to add your app name
 The cache invalidation reason

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: Invalidate by msId. NOT recommended, as this will invalidate the entire site cache!

members.name: siteId
members.doc: Invalidate by Site ID. NOT recommended, as this will invalidate the entire site cache!

members.name: collectionId
members.doc: Id of the Collection to retrieve

members.name: paging
members.doc: Maximum limit per response is 100, in first request cursor is None

members.name: collection
members.doc: Collection to be updated, may be partial

members.name: mask
members.doc: Explicit list of fields to update

members.name: collectionId
members.doc: Id of the Collection to delete

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • WIX_MEDIA
  • EXTERNAL
